:''Multiboot redirects here. For the specification, see [[Multiboot Specification]].''
[[Image:Dual boot icon.svg|thumb|Artist's depiction of a boot manager's menu offering a choice between Microsoft Windows and Linux operating systems.]]<!-- Actual screenshots are in individual 2nd stage loaders' articles. -->
[[Image:Dual boot icon.svg|thumb|Artist's depiction of a boot manager's menu offering a choice between Microsoft Windows and Linux operating systems.]]<!-- Actual screenshots are in individual 2nd stage loaders' articles. -->
â
'''Dual booting''' or '''dual-booting''' is the act of installing multiple [[operating system]]s on a [[computer]], and being able to choose which one to [[Booting|boot]] when switching on the computer power. The program which makes dual booting possible is called a [[Booting#Second-stage boot loader|boot loader]].
+
'''Multi boot''' or '''Multi booting''' is the act of installing multiple [[operating system]]s on a [[computer]], and being able to choose which one to [[Booting|boot]] when switching on the computer power. The program which makes dual booting possible is called a [[Booting#Second-stage boot loader|boot loader]].
